page.title: 20THE BASE HANGAR
page.content: The{base hangar}was built in 1967, it was the largest hangar in{Europe}and cost 50 million pounds. It is 90 feet tall and covers over 5 acres and holds 6 aeroplanes. If about eight inches of snow falls, the workers would have to get on the roof with safety harnesses and get the snow off because there is a danger of the{cantilevered {roof}collapsing. The roof is made out of{3100}tons of steel and it is held together by{250,000}bolts. There are several different bays in which workers inspect and fix parts of aeroplanes. There is underfloor heating but,in Winter,it is bitterly cold with the main doors open. They sometimes remove the front section of a plane to fit it in the hangar. {THIS INFORMATION WAS COMPILED BY THE {UPPER JUNIORS OF CARTERTON COUNTY {PRIMARY SCHOOL IN JUNE 1985.
